meanings.definition: A small projecting piece along the edge of a page for marking or holding a place.
meanings.sent1: She placed colorful tabs on the pages of her favorite book.
meanings.sent2: The tabs in the notebook helped her quickly find important sections.
meanings.sent3: The tabs on the book were like little flags waving for attention.
meanings.sent4: His tabs in the textbook were like breadcrumbs leading him through the content.
meanings.sent5: The tabs on the map made it easy to navigate through the city.

meanings.definition: A small flap or strip of material attached to or projecting from something, used to hold, fasten, or manipulate it.
meanings.sent1: She pulled the tabs on the zipper to open the bag.
meanings.sent2: The tabs on the curtains allowed her to adjust the lighting in the room.
meanings.sent3: The tabs on the shirt were like tiny handles for dressing up.
meanings.sent4: His tabs on the backpack were like little helpers carrying his belongings.
meanings.sent5: The tabs on the folder kept all the papers neatly organized.

meanings.definition: A section of a computer screen or document that can be selected for quick access to a particular set of functions or information.
meanings.sent1: He clicked on the tabs at the top of the browser to switch between websites.
meanings.sent2: The tabs on the spreadsheet helped her navigate through different data sets.
meanings.sent3: The tabs on the screen were like shortcuts to different worlds.
meanings.sent4: Her tabs on the document were like signposts guiding her through the content.
meanings.sent5: The tabs on the website made it easy to find what she was looking for.
